intro: Sisymbrium valentinum, commonly known as the Valentine's mustard, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, elongated pods that contain several seeds. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
